intro: Obione microcarpa, commonly known as the small-fruited obione, is a species of flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as a low shrub with narrow, linear leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in spring. Its fruit is a small, dry capsule containing several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Obione microcarpa is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments, making it an important component of local ecosystems.
